conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: walls extruded with visible thickness, multiple faces visible, interior volumes readable from an elevated angled view, and the ceiling/roof is removed to expose rooms.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and readable room volumes; cutaway is clean. View is slightly near-orthographic top-down but still angled with visible side faces and depth cues.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room arrangement matches the 2D plan well (kitchen/dining left, living center, bedrooms right, bath/closets/hall lower band). Some internal partitions/door placements appear slightly shifted/simplified versus the 2D (notably around hall/closet/laundry zone), reducing strict fidelity.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture and fixtures are present: dining table, living seating, beds, bathroom fixtures, and kitchen blocks. Placement generally corresponds to intended rooms; minor simplification/scale inconsistencies.

visual_clarity.notes: Walls/floors/openings are distinguishable with good readability. Lighting is even and interior is visible. Minor ambiguity in some door swings/openings and a few wall junctions due to rendering simplification.

detected_errors.description: Several door/opening positions and swing indications appear simplified or slightly misaligned compared to the 2D plan (especially around hall/closet/laundry and bathroom entries).
Small distortions/simplifications in internal partition geometry and exact room edge lengths (not a missing-room issue, but not perfectly proportional to the 2D drawing).
Furniture is broadly correct but simplified; a few items appear slightly oversized/undersized relative to room boundaries.

summary: A true 3D cutaway conversion with strong overall layout fidelity, but with minor-to-moderate simplifications in partition/door geometry that prevent a fully exact match to the 2D plan.
